result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin J Banks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-THC (>1000-2500 grams), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)3.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Reimbursement for Buy Money to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for City of Waukesha Police Dept. Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or drugs unless prescribed.  Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Maintain full time employment and/or school. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: As a condition of probation, non-working hours. Release for standard conditions. Commencing 04/17/14 by 8PM. LAST 90 days are STAYED for use at agent's discretion.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Justin J Banks in court with Attorney Rebecca M Coffee.  Kevin M Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing hearing.  State makes sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Coffee makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:   WITHHELD SENTENCE

TERM OF PROBATION:  3 YEARS

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____Pay $1,725.00 Buy Money to City of Waukesha Police Department 
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 

COSTS:  $268.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME:  9 MONTHS (Last 90 DAYS STAYED and to be used at agent's discretion) - Non-working hours with standard release conditions to commence 4/17/14 by 8:00 p.m.

Felony Warnings, Voting Rights and Firearms Warnings provided to defendant
Sentencing hearing on April 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Justin J Banks in court with Attorney Rebecca M. Coffee.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  Attorney Coffee requests an adjourned date for sentencing.  Court grants request and schedules sentencing date.  Bail remains as fixed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.
Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

Defendant Justin J Banks in court with attorney Rebecca Coffee.  Barbara A Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. 
  Hearing scheduled for March 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.
